intro: Villaria fasciculiflora, commonly known as the clustered villaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are usually narrow and opposite, with a slightly hairy texture. Villaria fasciculiflora is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
